title: ‘Only 18% of transport firms have plans to keep global warming to 2°C or below by 2050’
lead: A new Transition Pathway Initiative study highlights the aviation sector is performing ‘particularly badly’ in terms of setting goals

title: Nearly 42% of Brits ‘expect to drive an EV in the next five years’
lead: A new report predicts more than 16 million additional EVs will hit UK streets by 2025

title: Office for Environmental Protection: Dame Glenys Stacey chosen as preferred Chair
lead: The Office will provide scrutiny and advice on the implementation of environmental law as well as monitor and report progress against Environmental Improvement Plans and targets

title: IMechE comments on Climate Change Committee’s Sixth Carbon Budget advice to government
lead: The organisation states it hopes the nation will embrace the CCC’s advice as an opportunity for growing engineering skills and economic renewal across the whole of the UK

title: New York’s $226bn pension fund to divest from fossil fuels by 2025
lead: It has set a long term goal to transition its portfolio to net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2040

title: Ofwat consults on what the water sector should look like by 2040
lead: It has launched the ‘Future Ideas Lab’, where ideas can be submitted on how the regulator could evolve the price review to meet the challenges faced by the water sector

title: US aerospace developer acquires Uber’s air taxi enterprise
lead: The company plans to offer an affordable, quiet and clean transportation solution using an electric jet with a range of up to 150 miles and a top speed of 200mph

title: Recycled wind turbine blades can help clean up cement production – but how?
lead: GE Renewable Energy says ground-up turbine blades could replace raw materials such as coal, sand and clay in cement manufacturing facilities across the US

title: EDF launches ‘cheapest ever’ tariff for EV drivers
lead: The zero carbon renewable ‘GoElectric 35 tariff’ offers the cheapest off-peak rate on the market at just 4.5p/kWh

title: Scotland awards £18m to support sustainable farming
lead: Letters with grant offers have been sent to more than 3,500 eligible farmers and crofters towards the purchase of agricultural equipment chosen for its effectiveness in reducing greenhouse gases
